headline: The poorest management among others
status:
25 August 2017
Helpful (3)
"The poorest management among others"
1.0
★★★★★
Former Employee
pros: Good Salary, convenient working location
cons: The directors and GMs generally fails to provide direction to professional staff. In fact, they are incompetent to lead consultant teams and to assist clients. The only thing they can do is to mislead directors and the client. It so happens that Executive Director loves this kind of lip service. That creates unfair working atmosphere and caused a lot of unnecessary politics within HKPC.
advice_to_mgmt: Executive Directors should have a consistent direction to build up HKPC philosophy. Up to now, many clients have suffered because of poorly performing consultant team. HK government should have put more effort to manage this NGO.

headline: Assistant Engineer (Intern)
pros:
If you prefer stability over anything else, this place is an good place to work in.
Salary is carefully evaluated so you will not underpaid.
cons:
The management revises the standard practice too frequently.
Supervisor-issued reference letter is explicitly prohibited - may affect career change.
advice_to_mgmt: Allow the communication channel between the management and the employees to be more practical and effective. The management should review the proposed policy change more carefully if it may affect morale of the employees.

headline: Consultant
pros:
A Great place for those who are (mentally) retiring
- Good work-life balance of my division, normally 9 to 6:30. Not much OT required.
- Good package and fringe benefits. 
- Great job stability, it's very hard for your seniors to fire you according to the procedure, even though you are not performing at all.
cons:
Hence, there are some colleagues just physically sitting there, and "fishing" for 4-5 hours a day. The seniors recognized it, but would just allow/ pretend that they do not know.

It's a great place to learn different aspects of business consulting, but you could never be a real specialist/ professional of a single aspect, because the team do not have the experience to share with you, and they are not dedicated in delivering the best quality work to client. "Been there, done that", and that's it.
advice_to_mgmt: The management has to seriously assess the performance of middle management, and ensure that they are going towards the business direction of their own BU.

headline: Not bad to work here
pros: Good enumeration package, training opportunity, think of new project ideas and execute.
cons: lots of overtime work. Need to deal with the useless SAP system, spending 40% of your time. Work like one-man band, need to deal with everything from finding projects, to chasing for payments from clients.
advice_to_mgmt: Better not to involve professional staff to deal with the SAP, let them concentrate on their projects.

headline: Personal Observations
pros: High job satisfaction, broad business network
cons: High turnover rate, OT til late night very often, office politics

pros: A good start in the consulting field.
